strategy: Introduce a post-binning normalization step: after one-hot encoding the binned categorical features, apply min-max scaling to each binned feature group. This ensures all binned categories contribute equally to the model, preventing dominance of larger or more frequent bins and improving convergence and R2.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']

# Handle missing values
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values in numerical columns with median
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median())
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median())
X_val[numerical_columns] = X_val[numerical_columns].fillna(X_val[numerical_columns].median())

# Fill missing values in categorical columns with mode
for col in categorical_columns:
    mode_val = X_train[col].mode()[0]
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(mode_val)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(mode_val)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].fillna(mode_val)

# One-hot encode categorical variables
categorical_features = categorical_columns
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)
X_val_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_val, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)

# Align columns to match training set
X_train_final = X_train_encoded
X_test_final = X_test_encoded.reindex(columns=X_train_final.columns, fill_value=0)
X_val_final = X_val_encoded.reindex(columns=X_train_final.columns, fill_value=0)

# Post-binning normalization: Min-M

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']

# Handle missing values
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values in numerical columns with median
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median())
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median())
X_val[numerical_columns] = X_val[numerical_columns].fillna(X_val[numerical_columns].median())

# Fill missing values in categorical columns with mode
for col in categorical_columns:
    mode_val = X_train[col].mode()[0]
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(mode_val)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(mode_val)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].fillna(mode_val)

# One-hot encode categorical variables
categorical_features = categorical_columns
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)
X_val_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_val, columns=categorical_features, drop_first=True)

# Align columns to match training set
X_train_final = X_train_encoded
X_test_final = X_test_encoded.reindex(columns=X_train_final.columns, fill_value=0)
X_val_final = X_val_encoded.reindex(columns=X_train_final.columns, fill_value=0)

# Post-binning normalization: Min-M
